ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla

Class MediaAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • ch.blinkenlights.android.vanilla.MediaAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SectionIndexer, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, LibraryAdapter

    public class MediaAdapter
extends android.widget.BaseAdapter
implements LibraryAdapter, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.widget.SectionIndexer
    MediaAdapter provides an adapter backed by a MediaStore content provider. It generates simple one- or two-line text views to display each media element. Filtering is supported, as is a more specific type of filtering referred to as limiting. Limiting is separate from filtering; a new filter will not erase an active filter. Limiting is intended to allow only media belonging to a specific group to be displayed, e.g. only songs from a certain artist. See getLimiter and setLimiter for details.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediaAdapter

        public MediaAdapter(android.content.Context context,
                    int type,
                    Limiter limiter,
                    LibraryActivity activity)
        Construct a MediaAdapter representing the given type of media.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context used to access the content model.
        type - The type of media to represent. Must be one of the Song.TYPE_* constants. This determines which content provider to query and what fields to display in the views.
        limiter - An initial limiter to use
        activity - The LibraryActivity that will contain this adapter - may be null

    • Method Detail

      • setExpandable

        public void setExpandable(boolean expandable)
        Set whether or not the expander button should be shown in each row. Defaults to true for playlist adapter and false for all others.
        Parameters:
        expandable - True to show expander, false to hide.

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(java.lang.String filter)
        Description copied from interface: LibraryAdapter
        Set a new filter. The data should be requeried after calling this.
        Specified by:
        setFilter in interface LibraryAdapter
        Parameters:
        filter - The terms to filter on, separated by spaces. Only media that contain all of the terms (in any order) will be displayed after filtering is complete.

        public android.database.Cursor query()
        Description copied from interface: LibraryAdapter
        Retrieve the data for this adapter. The data must be set with LibraryAdapter.commitQuery(Object) before it takes effect. This should be called on a worker thread.
        Specified by:
        query in interface LibraryAdapter
        Returns:
        The data. Contents depend on the sub-class.

        Description copied from interface: LibraryAdapter

        Specified by:

      • getLimiterType

        public int getLimiterType()
        Returns the type of the current limiter.
        Returns:
        One of MediaUtils.TYPE_, or MediaUtils.TYPE_INVALID if there is no limiter set.

      • getSortEntries

        public int[] getSortEntries()
        Return the available sort modes for this adapter.
        Returns:
        An array containing the resource ids of the sort mode strings.

      • setSortMode

        public void setSortMode(int i)
        Set the sorting mode. The adapter should be re-queried after changing this.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the sort mode in the sort entries array. If this is negative, the inverse of the index will be used and sort order will be reversed.

      • getDefaultSortMode

        public int getDefaultSortMode()
        Returns the sort mode that should be used if no preference is saved. This may very based on the active limiter.
